channel.title: Other problems
channel.description:
I have created my own server. I can get on through 127.0.0.1 and localhost, but how can I tell the server what ip address I'm running, so other people can play?
(Right now, other people can't play, cause I ned to forward the port, which im having problems with, so it may take awhile, but the above question still remains)
Thx[br][size=1]Posted at: November 12, 2006, 07:32:19 PM[/size][hr]...

item.title: Other problems
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

My router blocks hamachi for some random reason. When ever I try to connect, it fails, tries again, tells me it can’t connect, it fails, tries again, tells me it can’t connect, it fails, tries again, tells me it can’t connect, tries again, and so on.

Thats why I think its stupid

(And yes, I’ve put it on the allow list on all 3 of my firewalls)

Read full topic

hamachi isnt stupid as a mather affact 75% of the peoplehere use hamachi

item.title: Other problems
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

yes, i have a no-ip*, and I got the port forwarded, so now a new question arises, once I open the runserver and compile windows, how do I get them to reconize which server I’m running?

*(slomiscape.no-ip.info , port 5555)[br][size=1]Posted at: November 13, 2006, 08:47:58 AM[/size][hr]everyone, try now! It’s up! Someone answer the above question![br][size=1]Posted at: November 13, 2006, 06:42:16 PM[/size][hr]Everybody, it’s up, go on now! Someone please answer the above question!

Read full topic
